About Me

Michael Flynn is the principal analyst at Prior Analytics. He has 15 years of experience working as a researcher, applied statistician, and data analyst. He enjoys working with others to brainstorm new ideas and to help them solve problems. You can find a copy of his CV here.

During my time as a researcher I’ve dealt with many different kinds of research problems, and my work requires that I be able to connect technical and specialized research skills with communication skills that make my research accessible to a general audience—whether that be grant funding agencies or policymakers. My goal is to bring the skills that I’ve developed over my career to assist others in their own projects.

Education

Ph.D. Political Science | Binghamton University, New York | 2013

M.A. Political Science | Binghamton University, New York | 2009

B.A History, B.A. Politics | SUNY Potsdam, New York | 2006

Experience

Kansas State University | Associate Professor of Political Science | 2018-Present

Kansas State University | Assistant Professor of Political Science | 2014-2018

University of Alabama | Postdoctoral Fellow | 2013-2014
